artistsDescription: Explore Brazil's new music scene with artists whose sounds blend traditional and new.
charitiesDescription: From clean water projects in developing countries to cancer research, here are some of the organizations having reshape the world we live in.

albums.name: O Mundo Mora Logo Ali (The World Lives Close By)
albums.smallDescription: Pop songs that will bring you to ...
bigDescription: Bassist, singer and composer Pedro Mann released his first solo album — “O Mundo Mora Logo Ali” —  in 2014. The album produced by Mann and producer Lucas Reis goes back and forth between Brazilian pop influences, sophisticated arrangements and catchy sing-along melodies.
Mann is also one of the founding members of Rio de Janeiro’s instrumental powerhouse Bondesom with which he previously released three other albums.
Throughout his career as a bassist, Mann shared the stage with Geraldo Azevedo e Carlos Malta, Roberta Sá, Forroçacana e Nicolas Krassik to name a few.

albums.name: Aventureira
albums.smallDescription: Segundo trabalho da violonista, arranjadora, compositora, cantora e produtora brasileira.
bigDescription: Rio de Janeiro singer and songwriter Luiza Sales released her first album “Breve Leveza” in 2011. The album was produced in her hometown by Los Angeles-based engineer and producer Dan Garcia whose previous work includes Christina Aguilera, Whitney Houston, Earth, Wind and Fire and the Nevil Brothers.

Produced by New York-based producer Vinicius Castro, her latest album “Aventureira” is a crowdfunding effort which includes songs by Pedro Mann and Yuri Villar and brings a mix of Brazilian folk music, samba, bossa nova, forró, maracatu as well as jazz and latino influences.
“Aventureira” deals with longing, love and the future with an optimistic look and the freshness of the new Brazilian music.

albums.name: Vagalume
albums.smallDescription: Segundo trabalho da violonista, arranjadora, compositora, cantora e produtora brasileira.
bigDescription: Matheus von Krüger was born in Bahia — birthplace of Tropicalia and Bossa Nova legends João Gilberto, Astrud Gilberto, Gilberto Gil and Caetano Veloso — but never bragged about his musical heritage. Growing up von Krüger lived in Maranhão, Pará and New Zealand, finally putting his roots down in Rio de Janeiro.
Produced by three-time Grammy Award-winner Alê Siqueira, Vagalume takes von Krüger back to the small Bahia town of Imbassaí and signals a turning point in his career.

albums.name: Som Na Sala
albums.smallDescription: Segundo trabalho da violonista, arranjadora, compositora, cantora e produtora brasileira.
bigDescription: Segundo disco do sexteto instrumental carioca com sua mistura de MPB e ritmos latinos. E mais um pouco de texto aqui e ali e coisa e tal.

charities.name: Charity Water
charities.description: Charity: water is a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations. Most of us have never really been thirsty. We've never had to leave our houses and walk five miles to fetch water. We simply turn on the tap, and water comes out. Clean. Yet there are 748 million people on the planet who don't have clean water. It's hard to imagine what 748 million people looks like really, but one in nine might be easier. One in nine people in our world doesn't have access to the most basic of human needs. Something we can't imagine going 12 hours without.

charities.name: Casa da Árvore
charities.description: Inspired by the work and legacy of french pediatrician and psychoanalyst Françoise Dolto, Casa da Arvore is a Brazilian institution that develops children's mental health projects in some of Rio de Janeiro's favelas. By creating and providing a coexistence environment, these projects favor the creative potential of the children and their caretakers, encourages autonomy and promotes health.
